description.narrative: - Access to finance: The Project would support MEMCC''s lending activities and expand its outreach to serve more of the low-income active poor and the SME sector in Jordan, including women entrepreneurs who currently represent more than 65% of the Company''s borrowers; - Job creation: MSMEs are contributors to job creation in the Country. Supporting the development of the sector with reliable access to finance would play an important role in economic growth, generating employment, and providing opportunities to the underserved groups. -Demonstration effect: Through this Project, IFC is expected to act as a catalyst to encourage local banks and FIs to lend for longer periods and support MFIs growth. Further, it will enable MEMCC to better manage its risks and such, by which, setting an example in the market.

The project consists of a straight senior loan to Middle East Micro Credit Company MEMCC, one of the leading and well-managed commercial microfinance institutions in Jordan. Proceeds of the loan will be used to finance the expansion of the Companys lending activities to micro and small entrepreneurs (the Project). MEMCC seeks long-term funding to continue its growth and continue offering existing and new products to its target clientele. MEMCC is one of the leading microfinance organizations operating in all regions in Jordan and by end June 2012 served more than 17,500 clients, of which 65% are women, with a credit portfolio of US$25 million. MEMCC serves its clients through its well established network of 15 branches and staff of 172 people.

mailing-address.narrative: Mr. Naser Darwish General Manager - MEMCC PO Box 142356 Amman 11844 Tel: +962 6 5831188 ext: 101 Fax: +962 6 5826146 Email: mailto:ndarwish@chf.org.jo

name.narrative: MEMCC is headquartered in Amman Jordan. The company provides loans within the different regions of the Country through its 15 branches. Investment can be made throughout the country.

activity-description.narrative: A description that qualifies the activity taking place at the location.

sector.narrative: O-HA - Microfinance and Small Business - Non Commercial Banking
